author: Special Correspondent
text:
The museum on wheels, sponsored by the Government Museum, which visited the schools in the city created awareness on the historical and cultural background of the country among the student community.

The Museum, set up in 1851, was the second oldest in the country after the Kolkata museum. The models and photographs with explanation of each and every gallery have been displayed in the mobile museum.

The stuffed birds and animals in the Zoology gallery and the different types of rare plants and herbs in the Botany gallery are the cynosure of all eyes.

Department personnel explained the concept and background of the originals, models and photographs of the hoary past of the country to the students.

According to J. Mullai Arasu, curator in-charge, Government Museum, Salem, the mobile museum, will camp in Salem district for three days. On the first day of its visit, the museum camped at the Sri Saradha Vidyalaya, Marakkudi Government School and Jayaram School. It will camp in the Fort Government Girls HSS, CSI School and Little Flower School on Tuesday and the Government schools at Ammapettai, Mallur and Kajalnayakkanpatti on the third and final day on Wednesday.

The mobile museum has already visited Kancheepuram, Vellore and Krishnagiri.

After completing its schedule in Salem district, the mobile museum will visit Karur, Coimbatore and Erode districts, Mr. Mullai Arasu said.
title: Museum on wheels in Salem
